command: bash -c 'mp=/mnt/finance; dd if=/dev/zero of="$mp/.wipe" bs=8M oflag=direct status=progress || true; sync; rm -f "$mp/.wipe"'
explanation: Fills free space on a specific mount with zeros and deletes the filler file to prevent recovery of deleted data remnants.
rationale_steps: Target a specific mount to avoid system-wide impact
Write a large zero-filled file until the filesystem is full
Sync and delete the filler to clear free space
